intro: Lipochaeta lavarum var. maneleana, commonly known as the Manleana lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. It is often noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
